problem: At the beginning of my bike ride I feel good, so I can travel   20 miles per hour.  Later, I get tired and travel only 12 miles  per hour.  If I travel a total of 122 miles in a total time of   8 hours, for how many hours did I feel good?  Express your  answer as a common fraction.
chatgpt_solution: Let $h$ denote the number of hours that I feel good. Since I travel at a rate of 20 miles per hour for $h$ hours, I travel $20h$ miles in that time. Since I travel at a rate of 12 miles per hour for $8-h$ hours, I travel $12(8-h)$ miles in that time. Since I travel a total of 122 miles in all, we have $$20h + 12(8-h) = 122.$$ Expanding the right side and simplifying gives $4h = 122 - 96 = 26$, from which dividing by $4$ gives $h = \boxed{\frac{13}{2}}$.
